text: I never was a fan of Zelda games. I liked playing one of the GBA games, and I had played the original, but when OOT came, I didn't like it. I tried Twilight Princess and I just didn't get interested. When I got Phantom Hourglass as a gift, I loved it. After hearing of Wind Waker, I went and got it. AMAZING!!! I could not put the attachment to the game into words. Maybe i'm one for the cel shaded graphics, who knows? I do like Okami.

Otherwise, everything else about this game was alright.

text:
You’re sailing on, Link (repeat x8)
Onward lad!
O’er the briny sea!
On you sail!
Go...
Bravely to…
Uncharted… 
Lands far from home…
Fearlessly!
Fight evil!
Like a giant squid!
Or some imps!
And…
Big frickin’ birds!
They’re no match…
For your sword!
Or your bombs!
Go!!!

text: I loved the sailing. Made you feel like an adventurer on the big sea plus it was wide open whereas all other zelda overworlds are boxed in with mountains or hills. I still remember that part when the world is stormy and you have to go back to Windfall island and get the bombs. I was sitting on the sofa all wrapped up and looking outside to see it was also raining. So awesome.

text:
Loved the art style. It's also akin to sprites, the graphics are timeless and will never go out of date like the graphics in OoT or Majora's Mask or any game at the time. 

Cel shaded graphics won't ever be out of date because it's style over technical prowess. Likewise with sprite based games like the old Mario games or Metroid.
